The '''Tower of Pearl''' was located in one of the [[Twilit Isles]] according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''. 

Like the Twilit Isles, it was in the [[Shadowy Seas]], west of [[Tol Eressëa]]. There the tower rose pale upon the most western cape of the Twilit Isles.<ref>{{LT1|III}}, p. 68</ref> It was built in later days after Tol Eressëa was established, and was much sung in song.<ref>{{LT1|V}}, p. 125</ref> During his travels, [[Eärendel]] was driven there, where he found the [[Sleeper]] in the Tower of Pearl and woke them up with [[Littleheart]]'s [[Gong of the Children|gong]].<ref>{{LT2|V}}, pp. 254, 260. Cf. also ''[[The Book of Lost Tales Part One]]'', p. 15</ref>

== Other names ==
Its name in [[Gnomish]] was '''''Tirimbrithla''''', from ''[[tirin]]'' ("tower") + ''[[brithla]]'' ("pearl").<ref>{{LT1|Appendix}}, entries "Kortirion", "Silmarilli"</ref>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
In [[1915]], before any narrative, [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote a poem whose main subject is the Tower of Pearl in the Twilit Isles, titled ''[[The Happy Mariners]]'', which gives some details about its appeareance: the tower was white, glimmering like a spike in the evening, and it stood upon a dark rock.<ref>{{LT2|V}}, (iv) ''[[The Happy Mariners]]'', pp. 273-275</ref>
